Per Hornady:

Features:
V-MAX™ Bullets

Hornady’s V-MAX bullets consistently achieve rapid fragmentation at all practical varmint shooting velocities.
Hand Inspected

Every Varmint Express cartridge is hand inspected before leaving our factory, ensuring there are no cosmetic flaws and imperfections.
Powder

Each cartridge is loaded to ensure optimal pressure, velocity, accuracy and lot-to-lot consistency.
Select Brass

Hornady produces most of the brass for Hornady Varmint Express ammunition. All of the brass is chosen to ensure it meets our high standards for reliable feeding, corrosion resistance, proper hardness and the ability to withstand maximum chamber pressures.
Primers

Like the powder, each primer is carefully matched to individual loads, and all are chosen for their ability to quickly, completely and reliably ignite the powder charge.

Depending on the caliber, Hornady Varmint Express ammunition is loaded with Hornady V-MAX, HP, or NTX bullets.

THIS IS A COLT PYTHON HUNTER PACKAGE. THIS .357 HAS A 8" BARREL. AS YOU CAN SEE BY THE LETTER, IT LEFT THE FACTORY AS A HUNTER PACKAGE. THE ONLY THING IS...IT WASN'T ROLL MARKED "PYTHON HUNTER" ON THE LEFT SIDE OF THE BARREL. IT LEFT THE FACTORY IN SEPTEMBER OF 1980. THE ORIGINAL OWNER BOUGHT IT IN THE FALL OF 1980. HE DIDN'T HAVE ANYTHING DONE TO IT (NO REFINISH, NO BARREL REPLACEMENT, ETC). SO, SOMEHOW, IT GOT OUT OF THE FACTORY WITHOUT THE ROLL MARK.
WHATEVER THE REASON, THE GUN IS STILL IN VERY NICE CONDITION INSIDE AND OUT...WITH JUST A FEW VERY MILD HANDLING MARKS. THE FOAM IN THE BOX SHOWS SOME WEAR. COMES IN GOOD CONDITION AND AVAILABLE FOR SERIOUS BUYER ONLY . NO TRADE .

Used Brass Shell Cartridge Recycling

Golden Recycling buys large quantities of used brass shell casings for recycling from indoor and outdoor gun ranges in the Denver, Colorado area.  We also buy used nickel shell casings.  

Prices on September 6th are $2.23/pound.   

Once fired brass, other used brass shell casings and new brass casings are all bought at the Shell Brass price.   We cannot buy live ammunition. It is recommended that you separate brass from non-brass metals.

title: For Sale:  Remington 521-T .22 S, L, LR
postcontent: This is a Remington 521-T .22 S,L, & LR, 6-shot magazine fed bolt action rifle. It was manufactured in November of 1948 according to the date code stamped on the barrel,(R TT). It has the original 1907 sling and sling swivels, that are in good shape. It is all original, including the Lyman 57RS rear aperture sight that is in great shape, with very positive click adjustments, and the plain square post patridge style front sight. It also has the oversized "Target Style" bolt handle. There is a rear sight blank in the barrel dovetail that is factory original, too. The barrel shows light surface corrosion but no pitting. The bore and muzzle crown are in perfect shape. The stock has no cracks or chips but shows some wear, very good for a 64 year old gun, though! This model was one of a few that only had "Model 521-T" stamped on the barrel with no "Youth Special" or "Junior Special" markings on it, so the stock has a full 13" length of pull. It is incredibly accurate and feeds any .22 S,L or LR cartridge from the magazine. Included with the rifle is a 6 round magazine and an extra 10 round magazine, along with an exact reproduction owner's manual. This is a great shooter AND collector for a very good price.

title: For Sale/Trade:  ANTIQUE GUNS RESTORED/Professional Quality
postcontent:
Almost every family has great grandpa's old shotgun. It may have been in the family for generations! It is a keepsake but needs to be put into better shape. Parts may be missing. It may be rusty and the wooden parts deteriorated. You may simply want the old thing professionally cleaned -OR- you may want it put into LIKE NEW shape! Perhaps you wish to present this family treasure, fully restored for Christmas? Don't wait. It may take us DAYS to complete your project - once we get yours in line. 
We have a huge inventory or antique and hard-to-find parts along with hundreds of stocks and forearms. If we don’t have the antique part we may have to order it or – even MAKE it. As an example, most of the guns we restore are over 100 years old! As of right now, firearms pre 1899 are considered antique and are EXEMPT from federal law & ATF rules.
We can offer Professional Results. Your family heirloom will look, "Good as great Grandpa bought it!"
We are not a dealer and do not sell guns. However, we can restore your family treasure to its original out-of-the box appearance. Each project is priced based upon the customer's request and the current condition of the piece. Most of our projects are old shotguns and rifles. We accept antique gun projects from all states.
